samples.question: I mean, how how do we show politeness to people?
samples.transcript: I am not sure. I think like other cultures, we we try to show respect to older people. So, we do this in a number of ways. Like sometimes we might, you know, chat to them on the street and make small talk with them or something like this. You know, old people sometimes they feel lonely and they want someone to speak to. So if you are on the bus with them, you might talk about the weather or something like this. That might feel like a bit more of a natural approach rather than just listing. So a couple of a couple of ways, a couple of strategies there. First, in order to avoid listing, we can, you know, list one or two or maybe up to three things and then go into detail or we can talk through our uncertainty or talk through our difficulty with a question. Nothing wrong with doing that.

Like sometimes we might, you know, chat to them on the street and make small talk with them or something like this. You know, old people sometimes they feel lonely and they want someone to speak to. So if you're on the bus with them, you might talk about the weather or something like this. That might feel like a bit more of a natural approach rather than just listing. So a couple of a couple of ways, a couple of strategies there. First, in order to avoid listing, we can, you know, list one or two or maybe up to three things and then go into detail or we can talk through our uncertainty or talk through our difficulty with a question. Nothing wrong with doing that.

So a couple of a couple of ways, a couple of strategies there. First, in order to avoid listing, we can, you know, list one or two or maybe up to three things and then go into detail or we can talk through our uncertainty or talk through our difficulty with a question. Nothing wrong with doing that.

samples.transcript_original: >> Oh, I don't think so. I think in cities people are more polite because they are um they have more more chances to be educated and they re >> Yeah.

samples.question: The key question is, can she hold it together on test day?
samples.transcript: She certainly, you know, she has all of the skills.
samples.transcript_original: She certainly, you know, she has all of the skills.
samples.transcript_cleaned: She certainly, you know, she has all of the skills.

samples.question: It is a test, right?
samples.transcript: If you have ever had a driving test or a job interview, you you probably come out of those things thinking like, "damn it. I I did not I did not do as well as I know I can do." And it is the same with the IELTS test that we always feel like I could have done better. I should have done better. I should not have said that. I should have said this, I should not have done that, I should have done this. it is a test. we and it always happens unfortunately. so yeah, in terms of language ability, the candidate certainly can get a nine. it is just a question of whether she can hold it together on test day. I I do not know if she is planning to take another IELTS test soon. I know she is done some IELTS tests in the past. I would say, you know, on the one hand, I would say forget about the nine. You do not need the nine. You do not need to prove anything to anyone. you you have mastered the English language. does not make any difference whether you get a nine or not. But I know if I was in her position as also an an uber competitive person, if I knew I could get the nine, I would want that nine. And so I can understand if the candidate wants to wants to go down that road of getting the nine. Examiners generally if they can avoid giving a nine, they prefer to give 8.5s. but yeah, an amazing performance. Very very well done. 8.5. The candidate is at C2 level for me. But you let me know what you think.

samples.question: Is there anything I have said that you disagree with?
samples.transcript: Let me know. as always, if you would like to have your own free practice IELTS speaking test with this level of detailed feedback, which you get nowhere else, then let me know. I am I collect all of my candidates from two places, my Facebook group and my Telegram groups. Links to both of those are in the description. Candidates are always selected at random. There are some minor exceptions, but usually candidates are selected at random for these tests. If you want to avoid the random process and you want to guarantee a speaking test or a writing check, you can pay for one. a full list of my services and prices are a full list is available on my website, expertexaminer.com. Links to everything are given in the description. Anyway, this has been a long one. More videos from me coming soon.
